Package battleship

Class Cell

java.lang.Object
battleship.Cell
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Cell extends Object implements Serializable
A single spot on the Battleship game board. A cell knows if there is a ship on it, and it remembers if it has been hit.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final char
    HIDDEN_SHIP_SECTION
    Character to display for a ship section that has not been sunk, when revealing the hidden locations of ships
    static final char
    HIT_SHIP_SECTION
    Character to display for a ship that has been hit but not sunk
    static final char
    HIT_WATER
    Character to display for a water cell that has been hit
    static final char
    PRISTINE_WATER
    Character to display for a water cell that has not been hit.
    static final char
    SUNK_SHIP_SECTION
    Character to display for a ship that has been entirely sunk

    • PRISTINE_WATER

      public static final char PRISTINE_WATER
      Character to display for a water cell that has not been hit. This character is also used for an unhit ship segment.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

      public static final char HIDDEN_SHIP_SECTION
      Character to display for a ship section that has not been sunk, when revealing the hidden locations of ships

  • Constructor Details

    • Cell

      public Cell(int row, int column)
      Create a new cell.
      Parameters:
      row - the cell's row position
      column - the cell's column position

  • Method Details

    • putShip

      public void putShip(Ship ship) throws OverlapException
      Place a ship on this cell. Of course, ships typically cover more than one Cell, so the same ship will usually be passed to more than one Cell's putShip method.
      Parameters:
      ship - the ship that is to be on this Cell
      Throws:
      OverlapException - if there is already a ship here.

    • hit

      public void hit() throws CellPlayedException
      Simulate hitting this cell. If there is a ship here, it will be hit. Calling this method changes the status of the cell, as reflected by displayChar() and displayHitStatus().
      Throws:
      CellPlayedException - if this cell had already been hit
      See Also:
      • Ship.hit()

    • displayHitStatus

      public char displayHitStatus()
      Return a character representing the state of this Cell but without revealing unhit portions of ships. Unhit portions of ships appear as PRISTINE_WATER.
      Returns:
      one of the characters declared as a constant static field in this class, according to the state of the cell and the state of the ship upon it, if any.

    • displayChar

      public char displayChar()
      Return a character representing the state of this Cell. This display method reveals all.
      Returns:
      one of the characters declared as a constant static field in this class, according to the state of the cell and the state of the ship upon it, if any.
